page.title: 01Findern
page.content: {Findern}is about nine hundred years old, it is a very peaceful village. There is a village green which has houses round it built in the seventeenth and eighteenth century. In{Findern}there are three main shops one of which is a post office, another shop is a decorators which once was a bakery. On the street called Castle Hill there is a village hall which was built in 1982. Where the hall is there used to be{Findern Castle,}hence the name.The oldest house in Findern is now Archway Motors which used to be called Yew Tree Farm. New estates have been built in the last ten years. A new dual carriage road the A38 was built off{Burton Road}ten years ago. The present{church}was built in 1864 but an earlier one was built on the same site.The{farming}is mostly dairy cattle on rough pasture.
